db:abstract.db:para: Controls video recording with the Camera.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: CameraRecorder allows recording camera streams to files, and adjusting recording settings and metadata for videos.
It should not be constructed separately, instead the videoRecorder property of a Camera should be used.
There are many different settings for each part of the recording process (audio, video, and output formats), as well as control over muting and where to store the output file.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] actualLocation : string
db:section.db:para: This property holds the actual location of the last saved media content. The actual location is usually available after the recording starts, and reset when new location is set or the new recording starts.

db:section.db:title: audioBitRate : int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the audio bit rate (in bits per second) to be used for recording video.

db:section.db:title: audioChannels : int
db:section.db:para: This property indicates the number of audio channels to be encoded while recording video (1 is mono, 2 is stereo).

db:section.db:title: audioCodec : string
db:section.db:para: This property holds the audio codec to be used for recording video. Typically this is aac or amr-wb.

db:section.db:title: audioEncodingMode : enumeration
db:section.db:para: The type of encoding method to use when recording audio.

db:td.db:para: Encoding will aim to have a constant quality, adjusting bitrate to fit. This is the default. The bitrate setting will be ignored.
Encoding will use a constant bit rate, adjust quality to fit. This is appropriate if you are trying to optimize for space.
Encoding will try to keep an average bitrate setting, but will use more or less as needed.

db:section.db:title: audioSampleRate : int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the sample rate to be used to encode audio while recording video.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] duration : int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the duration (in miliseconds) of the last recording.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] errorCode : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the last error code.

db:td.db:para: Device is not ready or not available.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] errorString : string
db:section.db:para: This property holds the description of the last error.

db:section.db:title: frameRate : qreal
db:section.db:para: This property holds the framerate (in frames per second) to be used for recording video.

db:section.db:title: mediaContainer : string
db:section.db:para: This property holds the media container to be used for recording video. Typically this is mp4.

db:section.db:title: muted : bool
db:section.db:para: This property indicates whether the audio input is muted during recording.

db:section.db:title: outputLocation : string
db:section.db:para: This property holds the destination location of the media content. If the location is empty, the recorder uses the system-specific place and file naming scheme.

db:section.db:title: recorderState : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the current state of the camera recorder object.
The state can be one of these two:

db:td.db:para: The camera is not recording video.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] recorderStatus : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the current status of media recording.

db:td.db:para: Recording is not supported by the camera.
The recorder is available but not loaded.
The recorder is initialized and ready to record media.
Recording is requested but not active yet.
Recording is stopped with media being finalized.

db:section.db:title: resolution : size
db:section.db:para: This property holds the video frame dimensions to be used for video capture.

db:section.db:title: videoBitRate : int
db:section.db:para: This property holds the bit rate (in bits per second) to be used for recording video.

db:section.db:title: videoCodec : string
db:section.db:para: This property holds the video codec to be used for recording video. Typically this is h264.

db:section.db:title: videoEncodingMode : enumeration
db:section.db:para: This property holds the type of encoding method to be used for recording video.
The following are the different encoding methods used:

db:td.db:para: Encoding will aim to have a constant quality, adjusting bitrate to fit. This is the default. The bitrate setting will be ignored.
Encoding will use a constant bit rate, adjust quality to fit. This is appropriate if you are trying to optimize for space.
Encoding will try to keep an average bitrate setting, but will use more or less as needed.

db:section.db:title: record()
db:section.db:para: Starts recording.

db:section.db:title: setMetadata(key, value)
db:section.db:para: Sets metadata for the next video to be recorder, with the given key being associated with value.

db:section.db:title: stop()
db:section.db:para: Stops recording.
